imagePullSecrets.description: Global Docker registry secret names as an array

kubeVersion.description: Force target Kubernetes version (using Helm capabilities if not set)

commonLabels.description: Labels to add to all deployed objects

enableServiceLinks.description: If set to false, disable Kubernetes service links in the pod spec

commonAnnotations.description: Annotations to add to all deployed objects

extraDeploy.description: Array of extra objects to deploy with the release

enabled.description: Enable diagnostic mode (all probes will be disabled and the command will be overridden)

command.description: Command to override all containers in the the statefulset

args.description: Args to override all containers in the the statefulset

tag.description: Keycloak image tag (immutable tags are recommended)

digest.description: Keycloak image digest in the way sha256:aa.... Please note this parameter, if set, will override the tag

pullSecrets.description: Specify docker-registry secret names as an array

debug.description: Specify if debug logs should be enabled

adminPassword.description: Keycloak administrator password for the new user

existingSecret.description: Existing secret containing Keycloak admin password

passwordSecretKey.description: Key where the Keycloak admin password is being stored inside the existing secret.

enabled.description: Enable TLS encryption. Required for HTTPs traffic.

autoGenerated.description: Generate automatically self-signed TLS certificates. Currently only supports PEM certificates

existingSecret.description: Existing secret containing the TLS certificates per Keycloak replica

usePem.description: Use PEM certificates as input instead of PKS12/JKS stores

truststoreFilename.description: Truststore filename inside the existing secret

keystoreFilename.description: Keystore filename inside the existing secret

keystorePassword.description: Password to access the keystore when it's password-protected

truststorePassword.description: Password to access the truststore when it's password-protected

passwordsSecret.description: Secret containing the Keystore and Truststore passwords.

existingSecret.description: Existing secret containing the Keycloak truststore for SPI connection over HTTPS/TLS

truststorePassword.description: Password to access the truststore when it's password-protected

truststoreFilename.description: Truststore filename inside the existing secret

passwordsSecret.description: Secret containing the SPI Truststore passwords.

hostnameVerificationPolicy.description: Verify the hostname of the serverâ€™s certificate. Allowed values: "ANY", "WILDCARD", "STRICT".

production.description: Run Keycloak in production mode. TLS configuration is required except when using proxy=edge.

proxy.description: reverse Proxy mode edge, reencrypt, passthrough or none

httpRelativePath.description: Set the path relative to '/' for serving resources. Useful if you are migrating from older version which were using '/auth/'

configuration.description: Keycloak Configuration. Auto-generated based on other parameters when not specified

existingConfigmap.description: Name of existing ConfigMap with Keycloak configuration

initdbScriptsConfigMap.description: ConfigMap with the initdb scripts (Note: Overrides `initdbScripts`)

command.description: Override default container command (useful when using custom images)

args.description: Override default container args (useful when using custom images)

extraEnvVars.description: Extra environment variables to be set on Keycloak container

extraEnvVarsCM.description: Name of existing ConfigMap containing extra env vars

extraEnvVarsSecret.description: Name of existing Secret containing extra env vars

replicaCount.description: Number of Keycloak replicas to deploy

extraContainerPorts.description: Optionally specify extra list of additional port-mappings for Keycloak container

fsGroup.description: Set Keycloak pod's Security Context fsGroup

runAsUser.description: Set Keycloak container's Security Context runAsUser

runAsNonRoot.description: Set Keycloak container's Security Context runAsNonRoot

limits.description: The resources limits for the Keycloak containers

requests.description: The requested resources for the Keycloak containers

lifecycleHooks.description: LifecycleHooks to set additional configuration at startup

podAffinityPreset.description: Pod affinity preset. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

podAntiAffinityPreset.description: Pod anti-affinity preset. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

type.description: Node affinity preset type. Ignored if `affinity` is set. Allowed values: `soft` or `hard`

key.description: Node label key to match. Ignored if `affinity` is set.

values.description: Node label values to match. Ignored if `affinity` is set.

topologySpreadConstraints.description: Topology Spread Constraints for pod assignment spread across your cluster among failure-domains. Evaluated as a template

podManagementPolicy.description: Pod management policy for the Keycloak statefulset

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Seconds Keycloak pod needs to terminate gracefully

rollingUpdate.description: Keycloak statefulset rolling update configuration parameters

extraVolumes.description: Optionally specify extra list of additional volumes for Keycloak pods

extraVolumeMounts.description: Optionally specify extra list of additional volumeMounts for Keycloak container(s)

initContainers.description: Add additional init containers to the Keycloak pods

sidecars.description: Add additional sidecar containers to the Keycloak pods

sessionAffinity.description: Control where client requests go, to the same pod or round-robin

loadBalancerIP.description: loadBalancerIP for the SuiteCRM Service (optional, cloud specific)

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: Address that are allowed when service is LoadBalancer

annotations.description: Additional custom annotations for Keycloak service

extraPorts.description: Extra port to expose on Keycloak service

extraHeadlessPorts.description: Extra ports to expose on Keycloak headless service

extraPorts.description: Extra ports to expose on Keycloak headless service

enabled.description: Enable ingress record generation for Keycloak

ingressClassName.description: IngressClass that will be be used to implement the Ingress (Kubernetes 1.18+)

apiVersion.description: Force Ingress API version (automatically detected if not set)

hostname.description: Default host for the ingress record (evaluated as template)

path.description: Default path for the ingress record (evaluated as template)

labels.description: Additional labels for the Ingress resource.

tls.description: Enable TLS configuration for the host defined at `ingress.hostname` parameter

selfSigned.description: Create a TLS secret for this ingress record using self-signed certificates generated by Helm

extraHosts.description: An array with additional hostname(s) to be covered with the ingress record

extraPaths.description: Any additional arbitrary paths that may need to be added to the ingress under the main host.

extraTls.description: The tls configuration for additional hostnames to be covered with this ingress record.

secrets.description: If you're providing your own certificates, please use this to add the certificates as secrets

extraRules.description: Additional rules to be covered with this ingress record

allowExternal.description: Don't require client label for connections

create.description: Enable the creation of a ServiceAccount for Keycloak pods

automountServiceAccountToken.description: Auto-mount the service account token in the pod

annotations.description: Additional custom annotations for the ServiceAccount

create.description: Whether to create and use RBAC resources or not
Enable/disable a Pod Disruption Budget creation

minAvailable.description: Minimum number/percentage of pods that should remain scheduled

maxUnavailable.description: Maximum number/percentage of pods that may be made unavailable

enabled.description: Create ServiceMonitor Resource for scraping metrics using PrometheusOperator

path.description: Metrics service HTTP path. Deprecated: Use @param metrics.serviceMonitor.endpoints instead

namespace.description: Namespace which Prometheus is running in

interval.description: Interval at which metrics should be scraped

scrapeTimeout.description: Specify the timeout after which the scrape is ended

labels.description: Additional labels that can be used so ServiceMonitor will be discovered by Prometheus

relabelings.description: RelabelConfigs to apply to samples before scraping

metricRelabelings.description: MetricRelabelConfigs to apply to samples before ingestion

honorLabels.description: honorLabels chooses the metric's labels on collisions with target labels

jobLabel.description: The name of the label on the target service to use as the job name in prometheus.

enabled.description: Create PrometheusRule Resource for scraping metrics using PrometheusOperator

namespace.description: Namespace which Prometheus is running in

labels.description: Additional labels that can be used so PrometheusRule will be discovered by Prometheus

digest.description: keycloak-config-cli container image digest in the way sha256:aa.... Please note this parameter, if set, will override the tag

command.description: Command for running the container (set to default if not set). Use array form

args.description: Args for running the container (set to default if not set). Use array form

limits.description: The resources limits for the keycloak-config-cli container

requests.description: The requested resources for the keycloak-config-cli container

runAsUser.description: Set keycloak-config-cli container's Security Context runAsUser

runAsNonRoot.description: Set keycloak-config-cli container's Security Context runAsNonRoot

fsGroup.description: Set keycloak-config-cli pod's Security Context fsGroup

backoffLimit.description: Number of retries before considering a Job as failed

extraVolumes.description: Extra volumes to add to the job

extraVolumeMounts.description: Extra volume mounts to add to the container

initContainers.description: Add additional init containers to the Keycloak config cli pod

sidecars.description: Add additional sidecar containers to the Keycloak config cli pod

existingConfigmap.description: ConfigMap with keycloak-config-cli configuration. This will override `keycloakConfigCli.config`

enabled.description: Switch to enable or disable the PostgreSQL helm chart

postgresPassword.description: Password for the "postgres" admin user. Ignored if `auth.existingSecret` with key `postgres-password` is provided

username.description: Name for a custom user to create

password.description: Password for the custom user to create

database.description: Name for a custom database to create

existingSecret.description: Name of existing secret to use for PostgreSQL credentials

password.description: Password for the non-root username for Keycloak

existingSecret.description: Name of an existing secret resource containing the database credentials

existingSecretHostKey.description: Name of an existing secret key containing the database host name

existingSecretPortKey.description: Name of an existing secret key containing the database port

existingSecretUserKey.description: Name of an existing secret key containing the database user

existingSecretDatabaseKey.description: Name of an existing secret key containing the database name

existingSecretPasswordKey.description: Name of an existing secret key containing the database credentials

enabled.description: Switch to enable or disable the keycloak distributed cache for kubernetes.

stackName.description: Set infinispan cache stack to use

stackFile.description: Set infinispan cache stack filename to use

output.description: Alternates between the default log output format or json format

level.description: Allowed values as documented: FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL, OFF
